sec.title: BrightSky
sec.p: Patients: Customers receive free educational materials with every shipment. In addition, our secure web portal, BrightSky.com, features free videos, wellness tools, informative articles, recipes, fitness tips, and much more. Registered users can record glucose readings and other values, including medication, exercises, sleep, and mood. Users can also interact with peers in our community forum.

Educators: BrightSky offers a variety of educational tools for health care professionals, such as The Link (an educational newsletter) and a downloadable Glucose Meter Reference Guide. An educator can also facilitate an educational class.
To order, call 888-987-BSKY (2759) or e-mail education@brightsky.com.

sec.title: Arkray USA, Inc
sec.p: Educators and patients: ARKRAY offers a comprehensive GLUCOCARD® YouChoose™ Patient Wellness Program. Available exclusively to GLUCOCARD® patients, our wellness program provides online, video, and printed tips for moving more, reading food labels, testing more effectively, and making simple changes that can have a profound impact on your patients’ health and outcomes.
This wellness kit, along with online tools, is free and available for patients and diabetes educators. Call 800-848-0614 today for a free wellness kit.

sec.title: National Diabetes Education Program
sec.p: National Diabetes Education Program’s (NDEP’s) diabetes prevention and control materials are tailored for high-risk ethnic and racial groups, older adults, and children and teens.

list-item.p: You Are the Heart of Your Family . . . Take Care of It. This bilingual tip sheet explains the link between diabetes and heart disease for Hispanics/Latinos. It encourages patients to work with their health care team to manage their blood glucose, blood pressure, and cholesterol. A wallet card allows patients to track their target numbers.

Do It for them! But for You Too (¡Hazlo por ellos! Pero por ti también). This bilingual fotonovela features dramatic stories of Latinas talking to Latinas about preventing or delaying type 2 diabetes and being healthy for their children and themselves. The stories use 3 women’s challenges in maintaining a healthy lifestyle to convey an important message: Increasing physical activity, making healthy food choices, and losing weight (if you are overweight) decreases or delays your risk of developing type 2 diabetes.

sec.p: NDEP also added additional resources to Diabetes HealthSense, an online library that support people with diabetes, people at risk for the disease, and those who care for them in making changes to live well or facilitating behavior change in others. Diabetes HealthSense now includes more than 160 resources from 80 organizations. To learn more, visit www.YourDiabetesInfo.org/HealthSense.

list-item.p: Redesigning the Health Care Team: Diabetes Prevention and Lifelong Management. This guide helps health care professionals implement multidisciplinary team care for patients.

Helping the Student With Diabetes Succeed: A Guide for School Personnel. This guide helps students with diabetes, their health care team, school staff, and parents work together to provide optimal diabetes management at school.

Diabetes Numbers At-a-Glance 2012. Based on American Diabetes Association clinical recommendations, this handy pocket guide provides a list of current recommendations to diagnose and manage prediabetes and diabetes.

You Are the Heart of Your Family . . . Take Care of It. Released in 2012, this bilingual flip chart can help promotoras, community health workers, and other health educators teach Hispanic and Latino Americans about the link between diabetes and heart disease. It includes easy-to-understand illustrations, scripted presentations in Spanish and English, and questions to facilitate discussion.

Living a Balanced Life With Diabetes: A Toolkit Addressing Psychosocial Issues for American Indian and Alaska Native Peoples. Available only online, this toolkit can help health care professionals address psychosocial issues with American Indian and Alaska Native peoples. It contains a variety of culturally appropriate materials.

sec.p: Limited quantities of hard copies can be ordered online. Single copies of all materials are free. Please see NDEP’s online publications catalog for more information.
